item.title: Baby Dragon! :)
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“whip of soulz, post:38, topic:337807”]NPC Ints (Placed in class5.java)

These can be a little more complicated.

if(i == ###) { // NPC ID
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; 
    class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry
    class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
    class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch.
         class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses, the [1] part
         class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID
    class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name
    class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level
}

That is for an NPC that only has one model for the whole monster, for example. A Chicken.

If the NPC uses more than one model, for example, a mithril dragon, then it would look more like this.

if(i == ###) { // NPC ID
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; 
    class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry
    class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
    class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch.
         class5.anIntArray94 = new int[4]; // Number of models the NPC uses, notice the [4] part
         class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID 1
         class5.anIntArray94[1] = #####; // MODEL ID 2
         class5.anIntArray94[2] = #####; // MODEL ID 3
         class5.anIntArray94[3] = #####; // MODEL ID 4
    class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name
    class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level
}

Notice the number on the left side of the model id going up by 1 each time?
And when using more models, the number next to “How many models the NPC uses” also has to change.

Notes

[ul][li]The model id’s must correspond to the model numbers that are placed in your models folder.[/li]
[li]When renaming models when putting them into your models folder, they must be renamed between 8000 - 15000, if not, then your cache may become broken, and simple models such as chickens, may be overwritten by the armadyl godsword special gfx.[/li]
[li]The polygon count must be between 1 and about 1500 at the max, or it will just disconnect you[/li][/ul]

I took this from here.[/quote]Oh. Neat!

Read full topic

item.title: Baby Dragon! :)
item.dc:creator: @whip_of_soulz whip of soulz
item.description:
@whip_of_soulz wrote:

NPC Ints (Placed in class5.java)

These can be a little more complicated.

if(i == ###) { // NPC ID
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; 
    class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry
    class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
    class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch.
         class5.anIntArray94 = new int[1]; // Number of models the NPC uses, the [1] part
         class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID
    class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name
    class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level
}

That is for an NPC that only has one model for the whole monster, for example. A Chicken.

If the NPC uses more than one model, for example, a mithril dragon, then it would look more like this.

if(i == ###) { // NPC ID
    aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60.anInt1406 = anIntArray72[630]; 
    class5.method165(true, aClass30_Sub2_Sub2_60); // Don't need to worry
    class5.aStringArray66 = new String[5];
    class5.aStringArray66[1] = "Attack"; // This string could be changed to anything, for example, in hunting, catch.
         class5.anIntArray94 = new int[4]; // Number of models the NPC uses, notice the [4] part
         class5.anIntArray94[0] = #####; // MODEL ID 1
         class5.anIntArray94[1] = #####; // MODEL ID 2
         class5.anIntArray94[2] = #####; // MODEL ID 3
         class5.anIntArray94[3] = #####; // MODEL ID 4
    class5.aString65 = "@@@@@"; // NPC name
    class5.anInt61 = ######; // Combat level
}

Notice the number on the left side of the model id going up by 1 each time?
And when using more models, the number next to “How many models the NPC uses” also has to change.

Notes

[ul][li]The model id’s must correspond to the model numbers that are placed in your models folder.[/li]
[li]When renaming models when putting them into your models folder, they must be renamed between 8000 - 15000, if not, then your cache may become broken, and simple models such as chickens, may be overwritten by the armadyl godsword special gfx.[/li]
[li]The polygon count must be between 1 and about 1500 at the max, or it will just disconnect you[/li][/ul]

I took this from here.

Read full topic

item.title: Baby Dragon! :)
item.dc:creator: @badger41 badger41
item.description:
@badger41 wrote:

[quote=“Java Is My Bitch, post:31, topic:337807”][quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=434208.msg3188855#msg3188855 date=1272052378]

Yep, I can get a clean RS Poser point values, Where there all at X0, Y0. Then I’ll set the WGT points to the body part, And then I can animate. RS Poser is actually easy to use when you use it for a while. I just wish there was a motion animator, And not a “Move point 12 40 over”. Still trying to figure out the HEX part of it, Still confusing as hell to me.

Yeahh, I could give it a go by importing it into 3ds Max and then using the motion editor, animate it through there and then export, not sure if the exported format will be compatible though.
[/quote]Uhhm, it’s 3000 square faces with the wings now. ROFL.
Is there a limit for NPCs?[/quote]

all models have the same face restrictions… doesnt matter if its for an npc, object, weapon etc…

Read full topic

item.title: Baby Dragon! :)
item.dc:creator: @Java_Is_My_Bitch2 Java Is My Bitch
item.description:
@Java_Is_My_Bitch2 wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:30, topic:337807”][quote author=man_killerx link=topic=434208.msg3188814#msg3188814 date=1272049650]
Yep, I can get a clean RS Poser point values, Where there all at X0, Y0. Then I’ll set the WGT points to the body part, And then I can animate. RS Poser is actually easy to use when you use it for a while. I just wish there was a motion animator, And not a “Move point 12 40 over”. Still trying to figure out the HEX part of it, Still confusing as hell to me.
[/quote]

Yeahh, I could give it a go by importing it into 3ds Max and then using the motion editor, animate it through there and then export, not sure if the exported format will be compatible though. :/[/quote]Uhhm, it’s 3000 square faces with the wings now. ROFL.
Is there a limit for NPCs?

Read full topic
